newsitem.title: USA: Biodynamics names new financial chief.
newsitem.headline: Biodynamics names new financial chief.

text.p: Biodynamics International, Inc on Wednesday said it appointed Nicholas A. Frungillo Jr. chief financial officer.
Officials of the company, which makes bioimplants for tissue repair, were not immediately available to say who Frungillo was succeeding.
The company also said it is relocating of its U.S. offices to Parsippany, N.J. from Tampa, effective May 1.
Previously, Frungillo was employed by United Counties Bancorp of Cranford, N.J., where he was treasurer and chief financial officer, Biodynamics noted.

"The move to New Jersey allows us to be in close proximity to many other biotechnology companies and will position us to attract additional talent as we move into the next generation of biotechnology products," Chief Executive Karl Meister said in a statement.
Biodynamics also has offices in Erlangen, Germany and processing and manufacturing facilities in Alachua, Fla and Neunkirchen, Germany.
